oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 33 d. Newspaper clipping: Good Blood. ... 'Mrs. Edward Hardin..."

oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Good Blood Means good health, and Hood's Sarsaparilla has an unapproached record as a blood-purifier. It effects its wonderful cures, not simply because it contains sarsaparilla but because it combines the utmost remedial values of more than 20 different ingredients. There is no real substitute for it. If urged to buy any preparation said to be "just as good" you may be sure it is inferior, costs less to make, and yields the dealer a larger profit. Get Hood's Sarsaparilla today. In usual liquid form or in chocloated tablets known as Sarsatabs.
Mrs. Edward Hardin and family have recently come to this place, where they will reside for some time. They were formerly residents of Tazewell.—The friends of Mrs. Samuel Blake will regret to learn of her serious illness at her home near this place.—Dr. N. M. Dukes is in Nashville this week attending the grand lodge, F. & A. M,—Miss Agnes Meek left Wednesday for Knoxville, where she will enter the training school for nurses at the Knoxville General hos- pital.—Miss Ethel Newman was the guest of friends in Knoxville during the past week.—Rev. J. C. Orr conducted the quarterly meeting services at the Meth- odist church here on the twenty-second and twenty-third of this month. The holy communion was administered at this service.—The Northside school has closed
